intro: Borreria humifusa, commonly known as the creeping borreria, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its prostrate growth habit, with small, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Borreria humifusa is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient plant in harsh environments.
